channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: UK Moves Jets To Mideast For Regional Security As Iran, Israel Trade Missiles

media:content.media:description: UK already has jets in the Mideast as part of an operation to counter threats in Iraq and Syria.

item.description: Britain is moving additional military assets, including fighter jets, to the Middle East to provide support across the region, Prime Minister Keir Starmer told reporters on Saturday as he was en route to a Group of Seven meeting in Canada.
item.content:encoded: Britain is moving additional military assets, including fighter jets, to the Middle East to provide support across the region, Prime Minister Keir Starmer told reporters on Saturday as he was en route to a Group of Seven meeting in Canada.

item.title: Satellite Images Show Damage At Iran's Nuclear Site After Israel Strikes

media:content.media:description: Satellite images released by Maxar show the extent of damage at Iran's Natanz.

item.description: Satellite imagery released by Maxar Technologies revealed detailed visual evidence of the destruction caused by Israel's Operation Rising Lion against Iran, a targeted military operation to roll back the Iranian threat of nuclear weapons.
item.content:encoded: Satellite imagery released by Maxar Technologies revealed detailed visual evidence of the destruction caused by Israel's Operation Rising Lion against Iran, a targeted military operation to roll back the Iranian threat of nuclear weapons.

item.title: 'It's Nothing Compared With What's Coming': Israel on Strikes On Iran

media:content.media:description: People gather near damaged vehicles in the aftermath of Israeli strikes in Tehran.

item.description: Israel pounded Iran for a second day on Saturday and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said its campaign would intensify dramatically, while Tehran called off nuclear talks that Washington had held out as the only way to halt the bombing.
item.content:encoded: Israel pounded Iran for a second day on Saturday and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said its campaign would intensify dramatically, while Tehran called off nuclear talks that Washington had held out as the only way to halt the bombing.

item.title: Elon Musk's Neuralink Device Helps Monkey See Something That's Not There
item.description: Elon Musk's Neuralink Corp used a brain implant to enable a monkey to see something that wasn't physically there, according to an engineer, as it moves toward its goal of helping blind people see.
item.content:encoded: Elon Musk's Neuralink Corp used a brain implant to enable a monkey to see something that wasn't physically there, according to an engineer, as it moves toward its goal of helping blind people see.

item.title: What To Know About Iran's Nuclear Sites

media:content.media:description: The Natanz nuclear facilities near Ahmadabad in Iran, before an Israeli strike.

item.description: Israel attacked multiple Iranian nuclear and military sites as tensions reached new heights over Tehran's rapidly advancing nuclear program.
item.content:encoded: Israel attacked multiple Iranian nuclear and military sites as tensions reached new heights over Tehran's rapidly advancing nuclear program.

item.title: Israeli Drone Strikes Refinery In Iran Gas Field: Report

media:content.media:description: Iran shares the gas field, which stretches across the Persian Gulf, with Qatar. (Representational)

item.description: An Israeli drone has struck a refinery in Iran's South Pars gas field Saturday, semiofficial Iranian news agencies reported.
item.content:encoded: An Israeli drone has struck a refinery in Iran's South Pars gas field Saturday, semiofficial Iranian news agencies reported.

item.title: US-Iran's Next Round Of Nuclear Talks Called Off After Israel Strikes: Oman
item.description: Oman's foreign minister says planned talks between Iran and the United States over Tehran's rapidly advancing nuclear program "will not now take place" after Israel's strikes targeting the Islamic Republic.
item.content:encoded: Oman's foreign minister says planned talks between Iran and the United States over Tehran's rapidly advancing nuclear program "will not now take place" after Israel's strikes targeting the Islamic Republic.

item.title: Huge Fire Breaks Out At 67-Storey Building In Dubai, 3,800 People Evacuated

media:content.media:description: This is not the first time the Marina Pinnacle - also known as Tiger Tower - has caught fire.

item.description: A massive fire broke out in a 67-storey building in Marina here, the Dubai Media Office (DMO) said on Saturday.
item.content:encoded: A massive fire broke out in a 67-storey building in Marina here, the Dubai Media Office (DMO) said on Saturday.

item.title: Minnesota Lawmaker Killed, Another Shot At, Trump Condemns "Terrible Shooting"

media:content.media:description: Former Minnesota House Speaker Melissa Hortman and her husband were killed.

item.description: The shootings happened at a time when political leaders nationwide have been attacked, harassed and intimidated during a time of deep political divisions.
item.content:encoded: The shootings happened at a time when political leaders nationwide have been attacked, harassed and intimidated during a time of deep political divisions.

item.title: Israel Attacks Iran News LIVE: US Still Wants Talks With Iran After Tehran Rejection: US Official

media:content.media:description: Israel, meanwhile, declared a state of emergency after attack on Iran

item.description: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.
item.content:encoded: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.

item.title: As Trump Turns 79, Washington To Host Military Parade Amid National Protests

media:content.media:description: Washington DC is preparing to host a large-scale military parade on Saturday

item.description: While the capital prepares for military fanfare, demonstrations opposing the Trump administration are set to erupt in over 1,500 locations nationwide.
item.content:encoded: While the capital prepares for military fanfare, demonstrations opposing the Trump administration are set to erupt in over 1,500 locations nationwide.

item.title: 400 Job Rejections To $130 Billion Firm: Palo Alto CEO Nikesh Arora's Journey
item.description: Mr Arora said he still has job rejection letters, and they remind him to keep going forward.
item.content:encoded: Mr Arora said he still has job rejection letters, and they remind him to keep going forward.

item.title: Russia And Ukraine Exchange Prisoners, But Moscow Says No War Dead Received

media:content.media:description: People in hazmat suits carry what is said to be remains of Ukrainian soldiers received from Russia

item.description: The exchanges are part of agreements reached by the warring sides during talks in Istanbul earlier this month. Ukraine earlier on Saturday confirmed it had received the bodies of its soldiers killed in action.
item.content:encoded: The exchanges are part of agreements reached by the warring sides during talks in Istanbul earlier this month. Ukraine earlier on Saturday confirmed it had received the bodies of its soldiers killed in action.

item.title: How Protests, Middle East, Bad Weather Can Rain On Trump's Military Parade

media:content.media:description: Nationwide protests, tensions in the Middle East could dampen spirits at the military parade

item.description: The celebrations will cost the U.S. Army between $25 million and $45 million, U.S. officials have told Reuters. That includes the parade itself as well as the cost of moving equipment and housing and feeding the troops.
item.content:encoded: The celebrations will cost the U.S. Army between $25 million and $45 million, U.S. officials have told Reuters. That includes the parade itself as well as the cost of moving equipment and housing and feeding the troops.

item.title: "Dangerous Manufacturing...": Boeing Whistleblower To NDTV On Air India Crash

media:content.media:description: Boeing whistleblower Ed Pierson spoke to NDTV on the Air India plane crash.

item.description: Ed Pierson - the ex-high-level Boeing manager-turned-whistleblower, who testified before the US Congress in 2019 about safety issues with the company's 737 Max variant - told NDTV of "chaotic and dangerous manufacturing" at its production facilities.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/952557/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>Ed Pierson - the ex-high-level Boeing manager-turned-whistleblower, who testified before the US Congress in 2019 about safety issues with the company's 737 Max variant - told NDTV of "chaotic and dangerous manufacturing" at its production facilities.

item.title: Indian Embassy In Tel Aviv Establishes 24x7 Helpline Amid Israel-Iran Conflict

media:content.media:description: Iran launched retaliatory strikes on Israel killing at least three people and wounding dozens. (File)

item.description: The Indian Embassy in Tel Aviv on Saturday set up a round the clock emergency helpline and advised Indian nationals to stay vigilant after escalation in Israel's conflict with Iran.
item.content:encoded: The Indian Embassy in Tel Aviv on Saturday set up a round the clock emergency helpline and advised Indian nationals to stay vigilant after escalation in Israel's conflict with Iran.

item.title: Photos Show Israel's Incredible Precision To Take Out Iran's High-Ranking Officials

media:content.media:description: Israel vs Iran: Israel's military said that the strikes had caused significant damage.

item.description: Israel Attacks Iran: Israel launched unprecedented strikes against Iran on Friday, targeting the country's nuclear programme and several military leaders and nuclear scientists.
item.content:encoded: Israel Attacks Iran: Israel launched unprecedented strikes against Iran on Friday, targeting the country's nuclear programme and several military leaders and nuclear scientists.

item.title: Iran's Top Nuclear Scientist Killed In Israeli Strikes Boasted He Wasn't Worried About Assassination

media:content.media:description: Israel launched unprecedented strikes against Iran on Friday.

item.description: Fereidoun Abbasi, a former head of Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation, was among several military leaders and scientists killed in the unprecedented Israeli strikes.
item.content:encoded: Fereidoun Abbasi, a former head of Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation, was among several military leaders and scientists killed in the unprecedented Israeli strikes.

item.title: "No Space For Bezos": Why Venice Locals Are Against The Billionaire's Wedding

media:content.media:description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and his fiancee Lauren Sanchez, are set to get married

item.description: Activists have ramped up their "No space for Bezos" campaign after Luigi Brugnaro, Venice's millionaire mayor, confirmed in March that the couple would be getting married in the city.
item.content:encoded: Activists have ramped up their "No space for Bezos" campaign after Luigi Brugnaro, Venice's millionaire mayor, confirmed in March that the couple would be getting married in the city.

item.title: King Charles Remembers Ahmedabad Plane Crash Victims At Military Parade

media:content.media:description: King Charles requested the changes "as a mark of respect for the lives lost."

item.description: Britain's King Charles and other senior royals wore black armbands at the "Trooping the Colour" military parade on Saturday as a mark of respect for the victims of the Air India plane crash.
item.content:encoded: Britain's King Charles and other senior royals wore black armbands at the "Trooping the Colour" military parade on Saturday as a mark of respect for the victims of the Air India plane crash.
